description: Teachers on the Isle of Man start industrial action "short of strike" in a dispute over their pay.
title: Isle of Man teachers begin industrial action 'short of strike'
title_page: Isle of Man teachers begin industrial action 'short of strike' - BBC News
maintext: The NAHT's Rob Kelsall said the union "would be taking stock" after four weeks of action and a full strike was still possible if there had been "no solution found", while the ASCL's Sara Ford said it was the union's intention "to not disrupt parents and pupils" at this time but it reserved the "right to move to strike action".
